Package pl.edu.pw.blog.web

Class ArticlesController

java.lang.Object
pl.edu.pw.blog.web.ArticlesController
@Controller @SessionAttributes("user") public class ArticlesController extends Object
Controller handling articles' entities (insertions, modifications, removals).

Views involved:

  • fragments/general.html
  • fragments/newlcard.html
  • articles.html
  • edit.html

Repositories involved:

  • UserRepository
  • ArticleRepository
Author:
Michal

  • Method Details

    • readUser

      @ModelAttribute("user") public User readUser(@AuthenticationPrincipal User user)
      Parameters:
      user - Authenticated user
      Returns:
      Model attribute of the authenticated user.

    • showArticles

      @GetMapping("/") public String showArticles(@RequestParam(name="sortBy") Optional<String> sort, @RequestParam(name="authorFilter") Optional<String> authorFilter, @ModelAttribute(name="newArticle") Article article, @ModelAttribute(name="refine") RefineResults refine, org.springframework.ui.Model model, javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Method used for displaying main page.
      Parameters:
      sort - Request param defining sorting order of the displayed list of articles.
      authorFilter - Request param defining method for filtering the displayed list of articles.
      article - Model attribute for bean validation while adding a new article.
      refine - Model attribute for displaying sorting options.
      model - Model object providing access to all the model attributes.
      session - HttpSession object providing access to all the session attributes.
      Returns:
      Main page including the list of articles, sorting and filtering options and form for adding new articles.

    • refreshArticles

      @RequestMapping(value="/refreshArticles", method=GET) public String refreshArticles(org.springframework.ui.Model model, javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Method used in conjunction with articlesChanges() method and Ajax calls from articles.html page
      Parameters:
      model - Model object providing access to all the model attributes
      session - HttpSession object providing access to all the session attributes
      Returns:
      Fragment of the main page containing the refreshed list of articles after database changes

    • addArticle

      @PostMapping("/addArticle") public String addArticle(@ModelAttribute("newArticle") @Valid @Valid Article article, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult errors, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Method aimed at processing an attempt to add a new article into database.
      Parameters:
      article - Model attribute for bean validation while adding a new article.
      errors - Errors that occur during the validation of a new article
      model - Model object providing access to all the model attributes.
      redirectAttributes - Attributes available after post redirection to another page
      Returns:
      Main page after an attempt to add a new article

    • deleteArticle

      @PostMapping("/articles/delete/{id}") public String deleteArticle(@PathVariable Long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Method used by authors to delete their articles
      Parameters:
      id - ID of deleted article.
      model - Model object providing access to all the model attributes.
      redirectAttributes - Attributes available after post redirection to another page.
      Returns:
      Main page after an attempt do delete article.

    • editArticle

      @GetMapping("/articles/edit/{id}") public String editArticle(@PathVariable Long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Method displaying edit page of a chosen article.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of edited article.
      model - Model object providing access to all the model attributes.
      redirectAttributes - Attributes available after post redirection to another page.
      Returns:
      Edit page if authenticated user is an author of a chosen article or main page otherwise.

    • modifyArticle

      @RequestMapping(value="/modifyArticle/{id}", method=POST, params="modify") public String modifyArticle(@ModelAttribute("article") @Valid @Valid Article article, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult errors, @PathVariable Long id, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Method invoked as a result of submission of edit form (edit.html).
      Parameters:
      article - Article object used for bean validation.
      errors - Errors that occur during the validation of an article.
      id - ID of edited article.
      model - Model object providing access to all the model attributes.
      redirectAttributes - Attributes available after post redirection to another page.
      Returns:
      Edit page if user is authorize to modify an article or main page otherwise.

    • modifyDeleteArticle

      @RequestMapping(value="/modifyArticle/{id}", method=POST, params="delete") public String modifyDeleteArticle(@PathVariable Long id)
      Method invoked from edit page when user attempts to delete article.
      Parameters:
      id - Id of deleted article.
      Returns:
      Forward reference to deleteArticle() method.

    • sendNewLCard

      @PostMapping("/likes_update") public String sendNewLCard(org.springframework.ui.Model model, @RequestParam(name="id") Long id, @RequestParam(name="liked") boolean isLiked)
      Method designed to refresh "likes" pane within article card on the main page after pressing like/dislike button. Used in conjunction with ajax call from articles.html page.
      Parameters:
      model - Model object providing access to all the model attributes.
      id - Id of liked/disliked article.
      isLiked - Boolean value indicating whether article is liked or not by an authenticated user.
      Returns:
      Fragment of article card within main page that displays "likes" pane.

    • articlesChanges

      @RequestMapping(value="/dbChanges", method=GET, produces="application/json") @ResponseBody public AjaxDBChange articlesChanges()
      Rest method used in conjunction with refreshArticles() method to detect changes in the database and dynamically reload fragment of articles page, if a change occurs.
      Returns:
      AjaxDBChange object containing refreshed sizes of articles and likes table along with the newest modificationAt date and refreshed authors names list.
